question:
The employee information of an Organization is stored in the relation: Employee (name, sex, salary, deptname) Consider the following SQLquery Select deptname from Employee Where sex = ‘M’ group by deptname having avg (salary) > {select avg (salary) from Employee} Output of the given query corresponds to

UGC NET III June - 2013
option_1: Average salary of employee more than average salary of the organization.
option_2: Average salary less than average salary of the organization.
option_3: Average salary of employee equal to average salary of the organization.
option_4: Average salary of male employees in a department is more than average salary of the organization.

Deposit_ Schema = (branch_ name, account_number, customer_name, balance)

The SQL expression Select distinct T, branch_name from branch T, branch S where

T.assets>S.assets and S.branch_city=”Mumbai” finds the names of

UGC NET III June - 2013 (Re test)
option_1: All branches that have greater assets than some branch located in Mumbai.
option_2: All branches that have greater assets than all branches in Mumbai.
option_3: The branch that has greatest asset in Mumbai.
option_4: Any branch that has greater assets than any branch in Mumbai.

question:

option_3: Key attribute Qty_sup is dependent on primary_key unit price
option_4: Key attribute V_ord_no is dependent on primary_key unit price

option_2: A value given to a particular attribute (e.g. height-230 cm)

option_4: A template for a group of things with the same set of characteristics that may exist in the real world

B) Select Name from people where Height>180;

C) Select Name from people where (Age>21) or (Height>180);

In RDBMS, the constraint that no key attribute (column) may be NULL is referred to as:

UGC NET II July - 2016

Which of the following statement(s) is/are FALSE in the context of Relational DBMS?

I. Views in a database system are important because they help with access control by allowing users to see only a particular subset of the data in the database.

II. E-R diagrams are useful to logically model concepts.

III. An update anomaly is when it is not possible to store information unless some other, unrelated information is stored as well.

IV. SQLis a procedural language.

UGC NET II July - 2016

In a relational database model, NULL values can be used for all but which one of the following?

UGC NET II July - 2016
option_1: To allow duplicate tuples in the table by filling the primary key column(s) with NULL.
option_2: To avoid confusion with actual legitimate data values like 0 (zero) for integer columns and (the empty string) for string columns.
option_3: To leave columns in a tuple marked as “unknown” when the actual value is unknown.
option_4: To fill a column in a tuple when that column does not really “exist” for that particular tuple.

question:
Consider the following two commands C1 and C2 on the relation R from an SQL database:

C1: drop table R;

C2: delete from R;

Which of the following statements is TRUE?

I. Both C1 and C2 delete the schema for R.

II. C2 retains relation R, but deletes all tuples in R.

III. C1 deletes not only all tuples of R, but also the schema for R.

Which of the following statements is TRUE? D1 : The decomposition of the schema R(A, B, C) into R1(A, B) and R2 (A, C) is always lossless. D2 : The decomposition of the schema R(A, B, C, D, E) having AD → B, C → DE, B → AE and AE → C, into R1 (A, B, D) and R2 (A, C, D, E) is lossless.

Relational database schema normalization is NOT for:

UGC NET II August - 2016 (Retest)
option_1: Reducing the number of joins required to satisfy a query.
option_2: Eliminating uncontrolled redundancy of data stored in the database.
option_3: Eliminating number of anomalies that could otherwise occur with inserts and deletes.
option_4: Ensuring that functional dependencies are enforced.
